body: are there any updates about this issue? @smurching
I implemented support for xgboost in #3085 (following the keras model implementation), so I think it wouldn't be too hard to adapt for h2o.

Yeah, we'd be happy to review a contribution adding support for logging h2o models from R. Following the approach used by the [existing keras flavor](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/mlflow/R/mlflow/R/model-keras.R) seems like a reasonable way to go, would be happy to discuss further if anybody's interested in contributing :)
Hey @smurching I'm interested in taking on this task as an exercise to get up-to-speed with mlflow. I'll let you know if I run into any question.

Great @yl790. I just pushed some tests I forgot to push to my [xgboost PR](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/pull/3085/files). I think these tests could be taken more or less 1 to 1 for h2o - and they are more comprehensive than the ones for keras, namely because they also test non-R / R API interactions. Also, I modified some util functions for creating `conda_env.yaml`, (see the diff in the PR) because previously, the structure of the file did not match the one that resulted from saving an xgb model from the Python API. I think this was not discovered because not tested for keras.
xgboost PR merged, let's proceed with more model flavours ðŸŽ‰ .

@smurching @lorenzwalthert I created [PR](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/pull/3416) for this and saw it working in my local dev env, but there are a lot of unrelated failures from other tests in Github CI (mostly along the lines of http 404/experiment does not exist, etc). I wonder if I'm missing something.

This should be considered closed with #3416 (should probably have used `closes #[PR number]` syntax to automatically close it with the PR).  @yitao-li I think it would be cool to implement more backends, i.e. sparklyr/MLeap, torch integration or lightgbm, following the same pattern as #3416. Also note that there is a tidymodels flavor discussion in #3418.
@dmatrix I think we can close this issue now :+1:  Thanks!
